Articles.Content:
This Kerbal was left behind in space after accident bounce from station and I accident to hit save. I was mean to hit F9. I could end flight and send this kerbal back planet start again. But I didnt. I keep it at orbit Kerbin. Station start move far, far, far away before I could come up design for pick up kerbal. But today I was bored and mess around rocket designs. Before I launch rocket. I kick 2 kerbal out pod. I was wanted see how do people put extra people into rocket when pod is far above. In end I never figure out so I put both under engine *eviil laugh* BLAST OFF! Who know what happen to both of them lol. When It reach into gravity turns... I spotted Kerbal floating approached. I cut off engine. I never reach full orbit. But I was able to manual into same speed as kerbal is. I switched to Kerbal and manual it to get in pod and de-orbit back atmosphere. I still wonder what happen to two who was sit under engine... Oh well. Here few picture from mission.

Kerbal approach Rocket

De-orbit complete and separation for reentry.

Engine section burn up... I though it look cool and post in here

Nice work! If you managed that, you shouldn't have to much trouble when it comes to rendezvousing with the station, to add more bits to it. Aim using the maneuver nodes, then when you're near catch up with it much the same.

I wouldn't worry to much about the guys under the engines. Mine sometimes like to watch from there.

They'll probably be escorted away before the next launch.

Thanks... i has build station few time. But... If never mess around with other two kerbal and put them under engine. I might will never pick up this lost kebal drafting in space. Just something luck times
Watch the first couple of minutes of this video and see one of the methods some people use to get their kerbals obboard.
It's nice video. Some mod I never seen b4 but look good

The grey engines beside the ladder while he was going up are from the b9 pack, the 2 large white hab modules are from the FusTek station parts pack, and the 2.5m docking ports are also from that pack. Rest is stock, but the boarding system is all just stock steel girders held on with a radial decoupler, with ladders on them and a steel plate walkway to the entrance of the capsule. I DID use some handrails from the b9 pack on the sides of the walkway, since it was made for show not functionality
